content:
Our Changelog & Friends proof-of-concept with Mat Ryer has been remastered! Now with full-length video on YouTube. Originally recorded: 2023-02-08

Mat joins us for some good conversation about some Git tooling that's been on our radar. We speculate, we discuss, we laugh, and Mat even breaks into song a few times. It's good fun. :link: https://changelog.am/107

Ch Start Title Runs
01 00:00 Let's talk! 00:37
02 00:37 Sponsor: Depot 02:12
03 02:49 Git & Friends 04:51
04 07:40 Git-Heat-Map 13:19
05 20:59 Git-Sim 05:47
06 26:47 git-bug 11:18
07 38:05 GitUI 04:06
08 42:11 Sponsor: Auth0 01:29
09 43:40 Does the language tools are written in matter? 07:10
10 50:50 Is Rust encroaching on Go? 01:25
11 52:15 "Rust Away" by Mat Ryer 03:26
12 55:41 git-branchless 05:29
13 1:01:10 How do you Git? 07:32
14 1:08:41 "Keyboard Wizards" by Mat Ryer 02:25
15 1:11:06 Sponsor: CodeRabbit 02:40
16 1:13:46 As a VS Code user... 06:01
17 1:19:47 Mat has a "pick" to share 07:10
18 1:26:57 Unpopular opinions! 02:13
19 1:29:11 Adam's unpop 04:33
20 1:33:44 Mat's unpop 02:46
21 1:36:30 Jerod's unpop 08:03
22 1:44:33 Bye, friends 01:46
23 1:46:19 Next week on the pod 01:02
will the other episodes get the YouTube remastering treatment or will be full-blown video podcast episodes on YouTube + Spotify in the future?
All episodes published this year and beyond are on YouTube. We will go back here and there and produce video for some shows like this one, but we arenâ€™t doing the full back catalog

RE: "branchless" being named after something it isn't
I believe Google Chrome was named after having much less chrome (the UI around the page, e.g. toolbars, etc) compared to other browsers at the time

If "oxidise" is rewriting into Rust, is "galvanise" rewriting out of Rust?
And "zig" is soooo close to "zinc", hmmmm...
